item.title: Soon Robot Transports Won't Honk Back When You Pull The Air Horn
item.description:
In an entirely unsurprising bit of news, the march toward automated distribution moves forward. Startup Otto is making self driving transports, adding to the list of potential disruptors in the shipping space which already includes Amazon’s drone delivery system and the “Uber for trucking” service Freight. So long convoys, hello unemployment lines.

  • story: MIT Technology Review

item.title: Shitty Batteries Just Got Shittier Thanks To Uber
item.description:
As if being stranded without a dying/dead phone isn’t already shitty enough (I’ve been there… lost in the rain), Uber found a way to make the experience even shittier: by charging you more for it. Thanks to creepy analytics and insatiable greed, you can add “battery tax” to the list of things eating your paycheque.

  • story: Tech Times

item.title: US Rejects Russia's Prom Date In Syria: Does Not Collaborate Or Coordinate With The Russians On Any Operations in Syria
item.description:
After proposing joint force strikes in Syria on Friday, Russia has been promptly shut down by the US. Pentagon spokesman Navy Captain Jeff Davis made clear that the US does “not collaborate or coordinate with the Russians on any operations in Syria”, going on to point out Russia’s support of Assad. In the end, nothing changes. Syria’s still rekt and remains the backdrop of a proxy war.

  • story: Yahoo News
